result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:29 AM Defendant Dennis Michael Couture in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Dennis Michael Couture.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Supervision Report - Justice Point

SIB $2500 with CBS Component of $250.00

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:39 AM Defendant Dennis Michael Couture in court, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Dennis Michael Couture.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Taber indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness, Detective Poplin, sworn in by court.  State begins examination.   11:44 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  11:45 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Taber.   11;48 AM  Attny Taber no further questions.  11:48 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Taber no argument.   Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

Atty Taber makes a request for bond modification in 22CF114. Court reviews the court record and bond on 22CF114. State objects to the bond modification. Atty Taber argues. Court will reduce the CBS to $250 CBS Component on 22CF114.
